Introduction

ONE OR EIGHT is an eight-member boy group, comprised of Japanese members MIZUKI, NEO, REIA, RYOTA, SOUMA, TAKERU, TSUBASA, and YUGA. The group’s name, ONE OR EIGHT, is inspired by a Japanese idiom meaning "All or Nothing," embodying their bold, fearless approach to both life and music. Fusing hip-hop and pop, ONE OR EIGHT seamlessly bridges genres while celebrating their Japanese heritage through lyrics, choreography, and a distinctive streetwear aesthetic.

ONE OR EIGHT and XG are both backed by the Japanese entertainment company Avex. XG is managed by XGALX, a subsidiary of Avex, while ONE OR EIGHT is backed by Avex in partnership with S10. By the tagline “BET ON YOURSELF”, they are a team of passionate dreamers determined to leave an indelible mark on the global stage. With their promotion on Korean music shows, ONE OR EIGHT continues to captivate audiences worldwide, setting the stage for a groundbreaking career.

The meaning behind the fandom name “1DERZ” represents the idea of ONE OR EIGHT and their fans coming together, embracing bold risks to inspire and create a future beyond anything ever imagined. It conveys the group’s message that there are no limits when they are together with their fans.
